content: green giant fingerless mitts a fingerless mitt design by janelle serio these mitts were knitted for my mother- in-law who has terribly painful arthritic hands and in particular thumbs i wanted a pattern that would fit her snugly and give support to her hands but would be warm and stylish as well i couldn t find this elusive pattern that was in my mind so i combined various ideas from several existing free patterns to create this one in short i frankensteined it to give the desired hand support i used super bulky weight yarn and needles that were two sizes smaller than recommended on the yarn label the result was a thick dense fabric that really hugs the hand i also included a fitted thumb gusset and a snugger-than- usual thumb they feel great the only thing to do now is knit myself a pair and since they knit up in about 4-6 hours it won t be long sizing by hand circumference at the knuckle gauge 3 stitches per inch in stockinette and in k2p1 ribbing  women s small 7 5  women s medium 8 5  women s large 9 5 where applicable throughout the pattern the sizes are written like this s m l the instructions pertaining to all three sizes contain no size distinctions please note that these mitts are meant to fit snugly if you do not wish them to hug your hands you may  knit them one size larger than indicated for your hand measurement  simply use larger needles e g us11 while knitting your indicated size materials etc  yarn 1 2 2 skeins lion brand hometown usa 81yards 100% acrylic or any super bulky weight yarn plus a little length of waste yarn about 6-8inches earthtogs cozy knitwear designs for people living on earth ©2012 page 1 this free pattern is for personal use only  needles set of 5 size us10 dpn s  yarn needle stitch markers cable needle and row the bar knit into the front of the new stitch created by the bar m1l place left needle under the bar between stitches from the front lifting the bar knit into the back of the new stitch created by the bar c4f slip next 2 stitches onto a cable needle and leave them hanging off the front of work while you knit the next 2 stitches then knit the 2 stitches from the cable needle c4b slip next 2 stitches
